entry.title: 最新获取京东eid和fp的快速方法
entry.content:
获取京东eid和fp的快速方法

最近一位牛人用Python写的JD的茅台抢购代码，可谓是风声水起，异常火爆，本着试试的态度也想耍一下，但是上来就遇到了问题，必须先要京东的eid和fp方法，于是乎在网上度娘了许久，终于搞了多种方法，亲试有效，这里Mark一下，以备后用。

方法一 、利用浏览器“检查”中的Console
首先需要登录京东账户，同时随便选一款商品，进入商品提交界面，利用谷歌浏览器右击“检查”，然后选择“Console”，在命令行输入“_JdTdudfp”，回车即可！

方法二、利用浏览器“检查”中的Source
首先需要登录京东账户，同时随便选一款商品，进入商品提交界面，利用谷歌浏览器右击“检查”（或点击F12），然后选择“Source”，点击“Watch”，点击加号，填入_JdTdudfp，即可查看到eid与fp！

方法三、编写html网页文件自动获取
创建一个html后缀的文件index.html，编辑模式打开，写入代码：

用浏览器打开京东，并登陆，随意选择一个商品进入提交界面，将上面创建的index.html文件拖到当前浏览器，即可看到想要的eid和fp值：

entry.title: 12代酷睿的笔记本该如何选择（一）
entry.content:
12代酷睿的笔记本该如何选择？等等党的完胜！

最低8核的12代酷睿

牙膏厂终于挤出来新鲜的牙膏了！可以和苹果拼一下了！
在Geekbench上已经出现了几乎12代酷睿笔记本处理器（Alder Lake-P）全系。
12代酷睿笔记本处理器全系偷跑：最低8核

后缀H的是45W标压型号，包括i5-12450H、i5-12500H、i5-12650H、i7-12700H、i7-12800H、i9-12900HK这6款；后缀P的是28W低电压型号，包括i5-1240P、i7-1260P、i7-1280P这3款。

参数方面，最低也是8核12线程（i5-12450H），而像是i7-12700H、i7-12800H、i9-12900HK和i7-1280P都是14核20线程，也就是6个大核、8个小核的配置，其中i9-12900HK作为全系旗舰，加速频率可达5.0GHz，单线程跑分1801，多线程跑分9847。

这次新推出的12代酷睿命名方式又和以前不一样了，不过性能级的标压处理器名称没有变化，比如酷睿i7-12650H这样的命名方式，结尾带有H就证明它是一款性能级产品，功耗45W。不过对于低压处理器的命名方式有变化，对于功耗28W的处理器，统一采用P后缀命名，对于15W处理器则统一采用U后缀命名。

12代CPU超强的性能

i5低压完胜11代英特尔酷睿i7-11800H

12代酷睿i5-1250P，是一个28W低电压处理器，拥有4个性能核心和8个效能核心，在Geekbench测试中跑出了和酷睿i7-11800H差不多的成绩，甚至单核性能还高了8%，多核性能也达到了11代酷睿标压的96.6%

标压更是完胜i7

12代英特尔酷睿核显性能

核显都基本统一了，低压处理器所有的酷睿i7都是96EU核显，酷睿i5都是80EU，酷睿i3都是64EU，更低的则是48EU。从规格来看核显和前代没变化，但Intel加入了核显的混合运算功能，某些情况下可以给独显加速

i7-12700H核显参数

搭载 12 代酷睿低压处理器 i7-1260p 的笔记本已经出现在了 Geekbench 上，数据显示其搭载了 96EU Xe 核显，最高频率为 1300MHz，参数与 i7-1165G7 的核显完全相同。

跑分方面，i7-1260p 核显在 Geekbench OpenCL 上跑分 17000+，与 i7-1165G7 核显跑分差不多。需要注意的是，目前 i7-1260p 核显跑分较少，可能不能代表上市产品的最终性能水平。

尽管 i7-1260p 与 i7-1165G7 的核显参数相同，但前者将支持 LPDDR5 内存，核显性能在理论上会有小幅提升。

entry.title: 美国重启“抗癌登月”计划 承诺25年内将癌症死亡率减半
entry.content:
美国重启“抗癌登月”计划 承诺25年内将癌症死亡率减半

2月3日，据央视报道，美国总统拜登宣布重启白宫的 “抗癌登月 “计划（Cancer Moonshot），承诺将致力于在未来25年内将癌症死亡率降低50%。

拜登任命在白宫科技政策办公室工作的丹妮尔-卡耐尔为 “抗癌月光 “计划的协调人，还宣布成立一个 “癌症内阁”，其成员将来自国家卫生研究院、国家癌症研究所、卫生代表与各行政部门，包括人类服务部。

美国国会为2016年的癌症登月计划提供了18亿美元的资金，为期七年。目前还剩下两年的资金，总额约为4亿美元。

据悉，”抗癌登月计划 “是前总统奥巴马于2016年1月28日签署的一份总统备忘录，以建立一个由副总统拜登领导的 “白宫抗癌登月计划特别小组”。

该登月计划指出了治愈癌症的巨大挑战。美国国家卫生研究院将花费1.95亿美元用于癌症研究，白宫将要求国会在2017财年批准7.55亿美元。

所有相关的联邦部委和委员会将尽力而为。登月是一项艰难而长期的工程，癌症治疗也是如此。而人类最终登上了月球，这意味着人类最终将征服癌症。

entry.title: Meta元宇宙：亏损超过100亿美元
entry.content:
Meta元宇宙：亏损超过100亿美元

Facebook Inc. 更名进入元宇宙,可以说是整个 2021 年最重要的科技事件之一，在全球科技界引起震动。

但从目前的消息来看，Meta现在的表现并不好。

据报道，2月3日美股上市后，Facebook母公司Meta暴跌逾22%至每股249.050美元，市值蒸发近1800亿美元。

Meta公布元宇宙结果：亏损超过100亿美元

根据 Meta 今天发布的 2021 年第四季度财报，Meta 的 Metaverse 业务“现实实验室”部门在 2021 年的营业亏损将超过 100 亿美元（约合人民币 636 亿元）。

2021 年，Meta Reality Labs 的收入将达到 22.7 亿美元，运营亏损 101.9 亿美元，这与扎克伯格去年对 Reality Labs 的预计投资规模相符。

2020 年，Meta Reality Labs 的收入将达到 11.4 亿美元，营业亏损为 66.2 亿美元。 2019 年，Meta Reality Labs 的收入将达到 5.01 亿美元，运营亏损将达到 45 亿美元。

Meta 公布 Meta Universe 结果：损失超过 100 亿美元

根据公司披露，2021年第四季度实现营收336.71亿美元，净利润102.85亿美元，这是公司自第二季度以来首次出现利润同比下滑（-8%）的情况。 2019 财年第四季度。

该公司还披露了今年第一季度的收入预期为27-290亿美元，对应的增长率为3%-11%，远低于分析师预期的301.5亿美元。

除了弱于预期的财报，Meta 的业务数据也令市场担忧。

元平台在去年第四季度达到日用户 19.3 亿（预期 19.5 亿）和月用户 29.1 亿（预期 29.5 亿）。这也意味着该公司的日常活动数据首次同比下降。

Meta创美股历史最大市值跌幅：一夜暴跌2376亿美元

据美国消费者新闻与商业频道CNBC报道，Facebook母公司Meta今日收盘暴跌26%，创下美股市场历史最大市值跌幅，下降了超过2370亿美元（约1.51万亿元人民币）市值。

扎克伯格在召开的财报电话会议上表示：“TikTok是一个如此强大的竞争对手，在拥有庞大用户群的基础上，还能继续以相当快的速度增长。尽管我们的发展速度非常快，但我们竞争对手的发展速度也相当快。”

在扎克伯格发表此番言论之前，Meta已经发布预警，称当前季度可能是有史以来增长速度最慢的一个季度。

对此，华尔街做出了惊恐的反应，导致Meta股价开盘暴跌25%，跌幅超过了苹果此前创下的纪录，后者在2020年9月市值损失了1820亿美元（约1.16万亿元人民币）。

另外，Meta押宝的元宇宙业绩也十分拉胯，根据日前公布的2021年第四季度财报显示，Meta元宇宙业务“现实实验室”部门在2021年营业亏损超100亿美元（约636亿元人民币）。

entry.title: 史上最强Redmi机皇来喽，12G内存、512G存储
entry.content:
Redmi史上最强机皇！！K50系列顶配版曝光

红米K50系列的最高版本配备了12GB内存和512GB存储，这是迄今为止最强大的红米旗舰。

去年，红米最强的旗舰机是K40 Pro+，它配备了12GB内存和256GB存储。现在，K50系列的最高版本提供了512GB的大容量存储，这可能是今年K系列旗舰的唯一512G版本。

据报道，与去年K40系列的布局类似，K50系列也有中杯、大杯和超杯三款普通机型，以及电子竞技版，分别命名为K50、K50 Pro、K50 Pro+和K50电子竞技版。

其中，K50 Pro+是红米K50系列的最强版本。它可能配备了联发科Dimensity 9000旗舰处理器，安兔兔的综合得分已经超过100万分。

据悉，联发科Dimensity 9000配备了1个Arm Cortex-X2超级核心，3个Arm Cortex-A710大核心和4个Arm Cortex-A510。在GPU方面，Dimensity 9000使用Arm Mali-G710。

值得注意的是，K50系列的第一个版本是K50电子竞技版，而K50 Pro+将在电子竞技版之后登场。

entry.title: Boring Ape creator, 27-year-old Chinese girl's NFT journey
entry.content:
Boring Ape creator, 27-year-old Chinese girl’s NFT journey

“The Bored Ape Yacht Club is undoubtedly the brightest new star in the crypto world right now, but most people probably haven’t heard of the creator of this headlining NFT project, 27-year-old Asian-American artist Seneca.

Of course, for Seneca herself, she had no idea that this body of work would be the catalyst for a technological revolution.

Today, the Bored Ape Yacht Club is definitely one of the world’s biggest NFT projects, and since it first appeared last May, it has quickly exploded onto the Internet, with prices rising to millions of dollars at one point. However, Seneca, its creator, was completely unaware that her work had become so popular until late last year, when she searched for the name on Google and woke up to it.

It’s no exaggeration to say that the Bored Ape Yacht Club has generated over $1 billion in revenue and drawn mainstreamers to the crypto space as well. Yet Seneca, who was at the heart of the project and played an integral role in turning the idea into a reality, has received no credit.

It’s a bittersweet feeling to watch NFT enthusiasts carry their various creations to every corner of the Internet. Imagine walking casually into a museum and finding your artwork hanging on a wall adorned with velvet ropes; similarly, when Seneca logged onto Twitter (her Twitter handle is All Seeing Seneca) and saw that NBA star Steve Curry was using her portrait as his avatar, she Her eyes widened in amazement.

“It really took me a while to digest it all,” says Seneca, sitting cross-legged on the floor of her Manhattan apartment living room in front of a small gray couch - with a random pile of pastels underneath - “ The world is changing so fast, and I’m still the same me.” Behind the couch is a small, cluttered work area - a studio, Seneca calls it.

Born in the U.S. to Chinese parents, Seneca grew up in Shanghai and attended Rhode Island School of Design in the U.S. After graduating in 2016, Seneca moved to New York City as a freelance illustrator, and this corner of her apartment became her office, where she specializes in designing vibrant, fantastical characters for advertising and marketing campaigns, such as some 2D animations. (Although her past work has been more of the same. (Although her past work was more abstract, she had to find a “realistic” way to translate her creative passions into currency.)

At the time, a creative agent named Nicole Muniz stumbled upon Seneca’s college portfolio and admired her skills, saying, “I really liked Seneca’s work, down to the fine lines and brush strokes. As a result, she began introducing Seneca to companies in a variety of industries, such as healthcare, insurance, green energy, and finance. Last year, Nicole Muniz gave Seneca a call with an offer: her childhood friend was creating something called the Bored Ape Yacht Club, and she joined the project as a consultant, although the team still needed some graphic designers to create the images. Virtually all of this happened in the early days of the NFT industry, and no one could have predicted that NFT would take the entire Internet by storm in its later years.

Nicole Muniz immediately thought of Seneca because of her “chameleon” ability, and she considered Seneca one of the few artists who could paint differently depending on the subject and the project. Now Nicole Muniz is co-CEO of Web 3 company Yuga Labs, the company behind the Bored Ape Yacht Club, whose other co-founder, Gargamel, is also impressed with Seneca’s Gargamel, another co-founder of the company, was also struck by the “expressiveness” of the character Seneca created, saying.

“It’s very, very rare. I could feel a whole range of emotions being conveyed. With the ape art design, we saw the kind of emotion we wanted: a sense of existential boredom.”

Nicole Muniz echoed this sentiment and said, “Seneca is particularly good at expressing that and bringing the character designs to life.”

In another work, “Can I Be M0ther,” Seneca shows the same girl. This time, however, her bug-like eyes appear soft and angular, as they shed thick, sticky tears and it is unclear whether veins, wires or threads are slipping out of them. These “fluids” fall and wrap around the girl’s outstretched hands, which hold what appears to be a faulty toy ape.

“As a commercial artist, I see myself as a kind of agent,” Seneca explains. “Art is an extension of your rich emotions, and art is very personal, and in a way you have to distance yourself from the work to experience that. That work is very much like me saying, ‘Can I take back my work? Can I regain my identity as an artist?

Seneca believes that her state may be caused by “lucid nightmares” that have plagued her for as long as she can remember. Seneca says she has memories from when she was three years old, but she had a nightmare - “I was in a stroller.

“I was sitting in a stroller,” Seneca recalled, “and it gave me a sense of smallness and vulnerability.”

Seneca doesn’t elaborate on the dreams, but we can already realize that these grotesque themes have been permeating her work, which she says is inspired by cosmic horror. Speaking of her early years, Seneca said.

“I was more interested in my imagination than in reality.”

Seneca confesses that she remained silent for most of her life and for much of her childhood, sometimes experiencing “fully lucid hallucinations. “

Every day before going to bed, Seneca remembers all the profound fears she experienced, thinking that if she could face them head-on, they wouldn’t appear in her nightmares - but often the opposite is true, and this mindset keeps her awake. “I don’t want to sleep because I’m afraid I’ll jump into that world of fear.”

Only recently has Seneca come to terms with the “crazy part” of it - turning her inner “surrealism and meaningless dark art” into something beautiful. In Seneca’s opinion, this approach is very healing. “That’s why I chose to do it,” Seneca explains, while admitting that she doesn’t want to share it with many people because she’s afraid they’ll think she’s “crazy.
However, Seneca is lucky.

What she feels is “crazy”, or “some form of crazy”, is very popular in the Web 3 space. Frankly, cryptocurrencies wouldn’t exist without the “impulse to deviate from the norm. Seneca said she hopes the NFT industry will still thrive in the years to come, and thanks to her experience with the Bored Ape Yacht Club, she has learned “a rich lesson in life,” so she hopes other aspiring creators will learn more about NFT and smart contracts, royalties, and more. Seneca admits: “Be strong in your beliefs and work very hard and be patient with yourself. Treat yourself well. In the crypto community and in the NFT space, things can move very fast and you need to keep an eye on it, but don’t care, focus on the track you’re best at and you’re bound to do well in the end.”

Of course, the so-called “good” is relative.

Although we don’t know how much Seneca has gained, at least for herself, the ratio of giving to getting is “not ideal. However, Seneca insists that she is grateful for the experience and for entering a completely unimaginable field, and since entering, she has become a firm believer in the idea of NFT as a way to validate and preserve art, provide royalties to creators, and make the art world more inclusive and less dependent on traditional galleries.

Seneca believes that the second NFT series she created, known as Iconoclast, is actually an extension of the surrealist foundation, but the work is more daring than ever. In fact, Seneca is very cautious when discussing her ongoing work, and always emphasizes mental health and the strength of strong women (although her new work may contain some “critical” sentiments).

Seneca concludes.
“I’m very optimistic about the NFT field, and I feel I’m perfectly capable of navigating it.”

entry.title: 2021年最大的科技IPO排名
entry.content:
2021年最大的科技IPO排名

对大多数人来说，2020 日历年将被永远铭记为可怕的一年，除了少数科技公司通过成功的首次公开募股 (IPO) 获得了全球向远程工作转移的回报。

根据彭博汇编的数据，仅美国公司在 2020 年的股票销售额就达到了创纪录的 4350 亿美元，其中超过四分之一来自 IPO——远远超过 2014 年的 2790 亿美元大关。这些新上市的绝大多数公司都将自己定义为科技公司。

Zoom、Snowflake、Asana、Airbnb 和 Palantir 等基于云的软件公司的表现都特别好，并且随着远程工作和电子商务在 2021 年继续成为许多公司的常态，它们的股价继续上涨。

[通过Computerworld 的时事通讯了解有关 IT 的最新思想领导力、见解、操作方法和分析。]
现在的问题是这种趋势是否会持续到年底。许多公司都希望在 2021 年首次亮相，以利用有利条件。但是，正如所有的市场亮相，时机的问题，与多家行业分析师在2021年开始担心有关泡沫。

以下是今年迄今为止最大的科技 IPO。

Samsara
物联网 (IoT) 公司 Samsara 于 12 月 15 日进行了强劲的 IPO。在将其股票定价为 23 美元的最高价后，股价立即上涨 7% 至 24.90 美元，公司估值为 120 亿美元。

Samsara 总部位于旧金山，专注于物联网连接车辆和工业资产所需的软件和硬件，为客户提供收集和分析数据的平台。

HashiCorp
开源软件公司 HashiCorp 于 12 月 9 日首次公开亮相，其股票在纳斯达克上市，高于预期，每股 80 美元，并在交易首日上涨了 10%。当天收盘价为 85 美元，对公司的估值为 140 亿美元。

HashiCorp 由大学好友 Mitchell Hashimoto 和 Armon Dadgar 于 2012 年创立，以其各种开源软件产品而闻名，例如广受欢迎的基础设施即代码工具 Terraform、密码管理工具 Vault 和容器管理工具 Nomad。该公司总部位于旧金山，但对其 1,500 名员工来说是“远程优先”的。

Braze
营销软件公司 Braze 在 11 月纳斯达克交易的第一天交易活跃，股价上涨了 44%。最初将 IPO 定价为 65 美元，股价上涨至 93 美元，公司估值为 84 亿美元。

这家总部位于纽约的公司专门研究客户参与度数据，帮助 HBO Max、丝芙兰和 Grubhub 等品牌更好地了解客户并促进他们的在线营销工作。

Backblaze
云数据和备份专家 Backblaze 于 11 月 11 日在纳斯达克首次亮相时并不是今年最引人注目的科技 IPO，在那里它筹集了 1 亿美元。然而，股价在交易的第一天上涨了 24%，但公司估值为 6.5 亿美元。

Expensify

费用管理软件公司 Expensify 于 11 月在纳斯达克上市，股价为 27 美元，公司估值为 22 亿美元。（它们在交易的第一天上涨了 45%，达到每股 39 美元。）这家金融科技公司于 2008 年在俄勒冈州波特兰成立，专门为个人和企业提供收据跟踪和费用管理软件。

Udemy
在线教育公司 Udemy 在 10 月底经历了艰难的上市，其股价迅速跌破 29 美元的上市价格，首日收盘跌至 27 美元，这家总部位于旧金山的公司估值为 37 亿美元。

GlobalFoundries
芯片制造商 GlobalFoundries 在 10 月 28 日纳斯达克首次亮相时以每股 47 美元的价格出售了 5500 万股股票，这是其预期区间 42 至 47 美元的上限。开盘首日价格震荡，跌幅高达5.3%，随后反弹收跌1.3%。这使该公司的价值约为 250 亿美元。这是今年迄今为止第三大科技 IPO，仅次于韩国电子商务公司 Coupang 和中国叫车公司滴滴。

这家总部位于纽约的芯片制造商于 2009 年从芯片巨头 AMD 的制造部门中诞生，由阿拉伯联合酋长国的主权财富基金穆巴达拉投资公司所有。

Informatica
数据管理专家 Informatica 于 10 月 28 日第二次上市，股票开盘价为每股 29 美元——这是其预期区间 29 美元至 32 美元的底部。这使该公司的价值达到 79 亿美元。股价在交易的第一天下跌了 5%，然后反弹至接近 29 美元的上市价格。

这家总部位于加利福尼亚的公司成立于 1993 年，于 1999 年首次上市，然后于 2015 年再次私有化，专注于云数据管理和基于订阅的消费模式。

GitLab
开发者协作平台 GitLab 在 10 月份迎来了强劲的 IPO。纳斯达克最初定价为 77 美元的股票在交易的第一天上涨了 35% 至 104 美元。这使得该公司的价值接近 150 亿美元。

从广义上讲，GitHub 的竞争对手一开始专注于开源私有代码存储库——而不是微软拥有的 GitHub，后者是迄今为止最受欢迎的公共存储库。然后，GitLab 扩展到整个软件开发生命周期，从源代码管理到部署、安全和监控，通过它所谓的 Devops 平台。正如Hacktivist所解释的那样，平台之间存在更细微的差异 。

Amplitude
继去年协作软件制造商 Asana 的领导下，分析软件公司 Amplitude 于 9 月通过直接上市在纳斯达克首次亮相——这意味着没有出售新股。（两者共享一个主要投资者：Benchmark Capital。）
这家总部位于旧金山的公司的股票开盘价为 50 美元，上涨 9%，收于 54.80 美元，公司估值约为 70 亿美元。Amplitude 专注于产品分析，可帮助企业跟踪访客对其数字产品的行为，以便对其进行衡量和优化。在首次公开募股时，Amplitude 将福特、沃尔玛和 Atlassian 等公司视为客户。

Toast
Toast 为餐厅业主提供各种软件产品，包括支付处理，于 9 月 22 日在纽约证券交易所成功上市，每股 40 美元，远高于预期的 34 至 36 美元，公司估值为 200 亿美元。上市首日股价继续上涨 56%，隐含估值为 310 亿美元。

这家总部位于马萨诸塞州波士顿的公司目前只为美国客户提供服务，它 不得不渡过一场艰难的大流行，在那里它削减了员工人数并看到交易量暴跌。

Freshworks
企业软件制造商 Freshworks 于 9 月 22 日进行了强劲的 IPO，开盘价为 43.50 美元，比预期高 21%，对该公司的估值为 120 亿美元。在纳斯达克交易之前，该公司已将其初始股价上调至 36 美元，高于预期的 32 至 34 美元区间。

这家软件即服务 (SaaS) 公司成立于印度，现总部位于加利福尼亚州圣马特奥，在 CRM、HR、营销和 IT 服务管理领域与 Salesforce、Zoho 和其他规模较小的公司展开竞争。它主要将小型企业视为客户，在其首次公开募股时包括普利司通、青尼罗河和英国广播公司 ITV。

Thoughtworks
软件咨询公司 Thoughtworks 在 9 月份的 IPO 表现强劲，在纳斯达克上市时股价上涨了 24%。该股开盘价为 26 美元，远高于预期的 18 至 20 美元区间，公司估值接近 90 亿美元。

由于 Martin Fowler 和 Jim Highsmith 等员工，Thoughtworks 于 1993 年在芝加哥成立，为敏捷方法在软件开发中的日益普及做出了贡献。它将克罗格、戴姆勒和贝宝等公司视为客户。

ForgeRock
身份软件制造商 ForgeRock 于 9 月 16 日在纽约证券交易所上市时首次亮相，股价上涨了 46%。

这家总部位于旧金山的公司的股价为 25 美元，高于预期的 21 美元至 24 美元区间，随后收于 36.50 美元。这使得该公司的价值接近 30 亿美元。

Couchbase
NoSQL 数据库专家 Couchbase 在 7 月 22 日上市时股价上涨了 39%，公司估值超过 10 亿美元。最初在纳斯达克交易所定价为每股 24 美元，该公司股票在交易的第一天跃升至每股 33.25 美元，上涨 38.5%，最后收盘接近 30 美元。

Couchbase 提供托管 NoSQL 数据库服务，并与 Oracle 和 MongoDB 等公司 竞争，后者在 2017 年有自己的轰动性 IPO，现在市值达到 230 亿美元。

Wise
英国金融科技的成功故事 Wise 于 7 月 7 日在伦敦证券交易所上市，作为直接上市——意味着没有新股出售——起始价格为每股 8 英镑（11 美元），然后在上市首日上涨 10% 至 8.88 英镑。贸易。这使该公司的价值达到 80 亿英镑（110 亿美元）\使其成为伦敦证券交易所有史以来最大的科技股。

这家金融科技公司由两名爱沙尼亚人创立，前身为 TransferWise，以其在线国际汇款和跨境支付服务而闻名。

SentinelOne
网络安全公司 SentinelOne 于 6 月 30 日在纽约证券交易所上市，股价上涨 20%，至每股 42.50 美元，远高于预期的每股 31 至 32 美元——该公司估值为 100 亿美元。这远远超过了竞争对手公司 CrowdStrike 在 2019 年首次亮相的 67 亿美元的重磅炸弹。

SentinelOne 成立于以色列，现在位于加利福尼亚州，专注于端点安全，使用机器学习技术在其 Singularity 平台产品下对抗网络攻击。它与总部位于英国的 Darktrace（今年也上市）和 CrowdStrike 等公司竞争。

就在去年 11 月，SentinelOne 以 31 亿美元的估值筹集了 2.67 亿美元，但仍处于亏损状态，上个季度净亏损 6400 万美元。

Confluent
Confluent 于 6 月 23 日以每股 36 美元的价格浮动，远高于其每股 29 至 33 美元的上市价格范围，对公司的估值为 90 亿美元。

这家位于加利福尼亚州山景城的公司为客户提供流行的开源 Kafka 流数据平台的企业版。零售商、汽车制造商、银行和其他企业使用该技术比传统的“静态数据”分析方法更快地获得对其业务的洞察，并被应用程序开发人员用作支持高性能事件驱动应用程序的一种方式。

Sprinklr

客户体验软件制造商 Sprinklr 在 6 月份的 IPO 中将其股票定价为 16 美元，低于其 18 至 20 美元的目标区间，对公司的估值为 40 亿美元。

Sprinklr 以其社交媒体管理、广告和内容营销工具而闻名，其客户包括世界上一些最大的品牌。它最近一个财政年度的收入为 3.87 亿美元，净亏损 4100 万美元。

Monday.com

以色列工作场所管理软件制造商 Monday.com 于 6 月 10 日在纳斯达克上市，股价为每股 155 美元，交易首日升至 174 美元。这使公司价值达到 76 亿美元。

基于云的平台允许公司创建可定制的项目管理工具，并与 Trello 和 Asana等公司竞争，后者在 IPO 时的市值为 100 亿美元。

ZipRecruiter

在线求职引擎 ZipRecruiter 于 5 月通过在纽约证券交易所的直接上市上市，股价上涨 17% 至每股 21 美元，公司估值为 24 亿美元。

Squarespace
网站建设者 Squarespace 于 5 月通过直接上市在纽约证券交易所上市，股票首次亮相时下跌 13% 至每股 43.65 美元，公司估值为 64 亿美元——远低于预期。

这家网站建设和托管公司由 Anthony Casalena 于 2003 年在他的马里兰大学宿舍内创建，作为博客，随着其广告在媒体中无处不在，这家网站建设和托管公司为世界各地的播客听众所熟知。该公司也一直保持盈利，上一财政年度净收入为 3060 万美元。

SUSE
谣言是真的。 总部位于瑞典的私募股权公司EQT在 5 月在法兰克福交易所的首次公开募股中剥离了 Linux 分销商 SUSE。首次亮相本身相当低调，股价攀升至略高于 30 欧元的发行价，公司估值为 50 亿欧元（61 亿美元）。

作为一家企业 Linux 专家，SUSE 与时俱进，现在专注于帮助客户驾驭容器时代，这一转变最终于 2020 年 7 月收购了 Kubernetes 专家 Rancher Labs。

Darktrace
英国网络安全公司 Darktrace 于 4 月 30 日在伦敦证券交易所上市，股价在交易首日上涨了 43% 至 3.58 英镑。这高于其 2.50 英镑的指导价，使该公司的价值约为 24 亿英镑。

这家总部位于剑桥的公司由一群数学家和前情报机构于 2013 年创立， 使用机器学习技术来分析企业数据，以帮助检测和应对网络安全威胁。它在最近一个财政年度创造了近 2 亿美元的收入，微薄的利润为 900 万美元。

Darktrace 还在与创始投资者迈克·林奇（Mike Lynch）结盟，后者因惠普以 110 亿美元收购其公司 Autonomy 的欺诈指控而面临被引渡到美国的问题。

entry.title: 小米12终于要来了！
entry.content:
小米12终于要来了！

今天下午（12月19日），卢伟冰更新微博自曝“换新手机了”，尾巴显示为“小米手机”。几乎可以肯定，卢伟冰已经正式用上小米12了。

此前，他发微博用的都是Redmi Note 11 Pro+。

结合圈内爆料，小米12预计最快明天上午开始正式预热，12月最后一周发布。

换手机了！卢伟冰喜提小米12：最快明日官宣发布会时间

在留言区，网友们也是各种催发小米12，毕竟距离月初雷军官宣已经过去了大半个月时间了。

就目前掌握的消息来看，预计小米12X、小米12和小米12 Pro三款机型先发，其中小米12X可能是一款6.2寸1080P小屏旗舰，处理器选用骁龙870或者骁龙888+。

小米12、小米12 Pro则采用6.7寸双曲面2K 120Hz显示屏，骁龙8 Gen1处理器，LPDDR5+UFS 3.1存储，支持内存扩展，预装MIUI 13系统，定制5000万主摄，最高120W快充等。

entry.title: 硬件狗狗3.0新版发布：支持Win11兼容检测、无忧升级
entry.content:
硬件狗狗3.0新版发布：支持Win11兼容检测、无忧升级

硬件狗狗新版增加了两个Windows 11小工具，都在工具箱板块，一是硬件兼容性检测工具，会从多个角度进行检测，包括CPU、显卡、硬盘、内存等硬件规格，引导方式、硬盘分区、安全启动(Secure Boot)、TPM版本等系统配置。

如果全部兼容，就会顺利通过；如果有某一项或某几项不兼容，也会逐一列出。

升级无忧工具，可以绕过CPU、TPM、安全启动的检测，即便有些地方不符合也能直接升级Windows 11，并且可选本地ISO或下载ISO、升级安装或全新安全，没有任何技术门槛。

硬件狗狗下载地址

硬件狗狗官网及下载地址：

http://gg.kkj.cn/

entry.title: 不限速？百度网盘青春版下周直接公测
entry.content:
不限速？百度网盘青春版下周直接公测

网友称从百度官方人员处获悉，百度网盘青春版计划下周一（12月20日）开始内测，安卓、iOS平台都有，数据可以互传。

不过百度网盘青春版现在人气太高，内测限制的1000人已经满了，百度众测公众号因此宣布下周的内测取消，直接变成公测了，不需要添加社群就可以参与测试，有更多的人可以体验到百度网盘青春版了。

entry.title: 联发科新旗舰天玑9000跑分首次公布！对比骁龙8 Gen1孰强孰弱
entry.content:
联发科新旗舰天玑9000跑分首次公布！对比骁龙8 Gen1孰强孰弱

发布第二天，联发科官方公布了天玑9000的跑分成绩。和骁龙8 Gen1相比，孰强孰弱？

首先是安兔兔v9.0.7。总分1017488分，CPU得分256987，GPU得分393810，MEM得分186890，UX得分179801。

作为对比，安兔兔官方此前曾公布v 9.2.1版本下，8GB+512GB骁龙8 Gen 1开发样机的跑分成绩，总分1031751分，CPU得分229976，GPU得分453190，MEM得分177467，UX得分171118。

由于版本不同，无法量化对比。但总体可以判断，天玑9000和骁龙8 Gen 1的综合性能在同一档次，各有优劣。天玑9000的CPU性能更强，GPU处于劣势。

GeekBench v5.1跑分方面，天玑9000单核得分1273，多核得分4324分。

骁龙8 Gen 1单核得分1226，多核得分3847分。

也就是说，天玑9000的CPU单核性能与骁龙8 Gen 1持平，多核得分领先12%左右。

纵向对比的话，天玑9000的单核性能排名安卓阵营第一。多核性能同样是安卓第一，仅次于苹果A15，在所有手机芯片中位列第二。

GPU方面，天玑9000进步也非常大，已经远远领先苹果A15，但是还不如骁龙8 Gen1，所以总分和A15基本持平，比骁龙8 Gen1还有大约9％的差距。

entry.title: 我国自主研制的首款内生安全交换芯片发布：取名“玄武”
entry.content:
我国自主研制的首款内生安全交换芯片发布：取名“玄武”

据央视新闻报道称，我国自主研制的首款内生安全交换芯片发布，这将大大提高安全问题。

报道中提到，我国自主研制的首款内生安全交换芯片“玄武芯”ESW5610正式对外发布，该款芯片是由天津市滨海新区信息技术创新中心研制，是国家“核高基”科技重大专项课题成果，旨在破解我国能源、金融、交通、电力等高安全等级信息基础设施的网络安全问题。

“玄武芯”ESW5610芯片设计吞吐能力128Gbps，支持48GE、8×10GE、10×10GE等多种接口模式，采用了硬件木马去协同、动态ID变换、多维表项防护、异构转发引擎等多项安全构造技术。

此外，该芯片对高安全等级网络基础设施中广泛部署的接入级交换芯片进行了内生安全设计，可有效抵御已知与未知漏洞后门的攻击，指数级提升网络交换设备的安全性。

entry.title: 暂停“搜索自动建议”功能30天后 微软Bing网站国内出现无法访问情况
entry.content:
暂停“搜索自动建议”功能30天后 微软Bing网站国内出现无法访问情况

有不少网友反映称，现Bing声明已无法查看，实测发现，Bing官网在多个浏览器已无法打开。截止发稿，微软尚未对此进行回应。

在这之前，微软Bing官方发布声明提到，根据中华人民共和国法律，Bing在中国内地暂停“搜索自动建议”功能30天。

微软必应（英文名：Microsoft Bing），原名必应（Bing），是微软公司于2009年5月28日推出，用以取代Live Search的全新搜索引擎服务。

根据Statcounter的统计数据显示，截止2021年11月，国内搜索引擎市场份额占比第一的为百度搜索，必应搜索以3.94%的份额占据第三。

虽然从数字上来看，必应搜索的3.94%与百度搜索的86.82%相差甚远，但实际上，排在第二的搜狗搜索市场份额也仅为4.69%。也就是说，必应搜索在国内还是有许多忠实用户，占据着十分重要的位置。

entry.title: SSD 1年来首次转跌 1TB TLC硬盘交易价降至240元
entry.content:
SSD 1年来首次转跌 1TB TLC硬盘交易价降至240元

国内一年中，全球半导体产能紧张，导致多种芯片都出现了缺货、涨价的问题，唯一例外的就是存储芯片了，内存及SSD硬盘价格甚至开始跌了，其中SSD硬盘一年来首次转跌。

来自供应链的消息，今年Q4季度（10-12月份），标杆性的1TB TLC硬盘的大宗交易价格比Q3季度下滑5%，只要37.5美元，约合人民币240元，是一年来首次转跌。

当然，这个价格并不是零售价，大家买到的SSD硬盘没这么便宜，不过这次的下滑意味着SSD硬盘市场风向已变，而SSD硬盘价格下滑主要原因跟手机市场相关。

去年各大手机厂商要抢华为手机让出来的市场份额，纷纷大量采购NAND闪存，推高了价格，然而今年手机市场不如预期，Q3季度的出货量还下滑了，特别是中国市场上，导致了闪存价格下跌，SSD硬盘也跟着下滑了。

entry.title: 消息称微软下一个Win11大版本明年10月才发：对系统深度打磨
entry.content:
消息称微软下一个Win11大版本明年10月才发：对系统深度打磨

对于微软来说，他们正在调整Windows 10、11的更新策略，简单来说就是大的版本将会一年一更新。

据mspoweruser报道称，由于当前Windows 11的Bug比较多，微软正在对这些问题统一集中并做修复，而这就导致一些更新要延后，所以Win11 22H1可以暂时不用等了。

报道中提到，微软将在2022年10月才对Windows 11进行重大更新，这也可以更好的打磨系统，同时也会让系统使用起来很少，不过虽然大的更新推进变慢，但是他们将通过每月的累积更新补丁提供所需的功能和改进。

之前微软就表示，将在未来几周内逐批向用户提供这一更新，以确保为所有用户提供可靠的下载体验。

微软现在正专注于Windows 11的开发，所以你可能不会对Windows 10的版本21H2太过兴奋。2021年11月更新只不过是一个累积更新补丁，并为企业客户引入了一些新的补充功能。

对于接下来两个版本系统的更新，”我们将过渡到一个新的Windows 10发布节奏，与Windows 11的节奏保持一致，目标是每年发布一次功能更新，”微软的Windows服务和交付主管约翰·凯布尔解释说。”下一个Windows 10功能更新定于2022年下半年进行。”

entry.title: 首发骁龙8 Gen 1 消息称小米12发布会定档12月9日
entry.content:
首发骁龙8 Gen 1 消息称小米12发布会定档12月9日


前几天高通发布了最新的骁龙8 Gen 1平台，毫无疑问这将是接下来安卓平台旗舰必备，抢骁龙8 Gen 1首发也成了小米与摩托之间最近的一场战争，最新消息显示小米将在12月9日举行小米12发布会，抢先发布骁龙8 Gen 1。

小米首款骁龙8 Gen 1处理器的手机是小米12没跑，只不过官方一直没有公布发布会时间，有网友爆料小米之家收到了最新宣发资料，显示在12月9日10：00发布会之后才能开箱，这意味着小米12发布会将在12月9日举行，而且一反常态在上午发布，不是更常见的下午或者晚上发布。

原因也不复杂，因为摩托已经宣布将在12月9日晚上19点半举行发布会，小米12要想真·首发骁龙8 Gen 1，那么只能在这个时间点之前发布。

值得注意的是，虽然在骁龙8 Gen 1公布之后，很多厂商都纷纷表态争抢首发、首批，但小米却是唯一一个得到高通官方认证的首发厂商。

除了雷军现身发布会之外，高通中国官微和高通总裁兼CEO安蒙的个人微博都转发了雷军的微博，帮助小米坐实了首发位置。

entry.title: 丹麦宣布COVID-19不再是公共健康威胁 9月10日起取消所有相关限制
entry.content:
丹麦将在9月10日之前取消所有剩余的COVID-19社会限制，因为该国的疫苗接种水平很高，卫生部宣布该病毒”不再对社会构成严重威胁”。卫生部长Magnus Heunicke周五在一份声明中说：”疫情得到了控制，我们的疫苗接种水平创下了新高。”这就是为什么我们可以放弃我们在抗击COVID-19时不得不引入的特殊规则”。

然而，他警告说，即使国家”现在处于良好状态”，疫情也没有结束，政府将毫不犹豫地”在大流行病再次威胁到社会的基本运作时迅速采取行动”。

根据《Our World in Data》，丹麦是欧盟国家中疫苗接种率第三高的国家，71%的人口已经接种了两针。马耳他为80%，葡萄牙为73%。英国为其62%的人口全面接种了疫苗。

根据同一在线科学出版物，丹麦每百万居民的冠状病毒新病例的七天滚动平均数为167，略高于欧盟的平均数149，但远远低于英国的数字492。

丹麦是欧洲最早在去年3月实行部分封锁的国家之一，当时政府关闭了学校和非关键的企业和服务的运作，它也是最早开始重新开放的国家之一，于今年4月21日推出了”冠状病毒护照”。丹麦的餐馆、酒吧、电影院、健身房、体育场馆和美发厅自该日起对任何能够证明自己已全面接种疫苗、测试结果为阴性且时间不超过72小时或在过去2至12周内感染过COVID-19的人开放。

而这一要求已经从8月1日起对博物馆等一些场所取消，从9月1日起对大多数其他场所也将消失，但在9月10日之前，夜总会和包括足球比赛在内的大型活动仍然需要有相关证明才能入场。

然而，对进入丹麦旅行的限制将至少持续到10月，因为这些限制是由该国执政党之间的一项单独协议所涵盖的，该协议在稍后日期才会到期。

entry.title: Developers, regulators say Apple's App Store changes don't do enough
entry.content:
Apple has announced a series of slight changes in settlement of a class action by developers, but they don’t seem to go far enough.

Developers are debating Apple’s statement of clarification around the App Store in resolution of a class action suit brought against it by developers in 2019. Some say the announcements don’t go far enough, but others welcome its slightly more open approach to payments outside the store.

10 years on, you can now email customers
Since it introduced the App Store more than a decade ago, Apple has always insisted that payments be primarily made within its ecosystem.

Developers have always been able to offer sign-up accounts outside the App Store, of course. But they have not been permitted to email iOS app users to let them know other payment methods exist. This might include an email sent to a customer at the end of a trial period that invites them to sign-up to a service, which they can now do.

[ Related: Tech event calendar: Upcoming shows, conferences and IT expos ]
This presumably means developers can request a person’s email and ask them for permission to receive offers. If they get the go-ahead, they can email offers — but still cannot do so from within their app.

Even with these changes, Apple continues to forbid developers from mentioning the existence of alternative payment options on their app description pages. As the legal agreement states: “By informing customers of alternative payment options, developers can avoid paying Apple’s commissions and, moreover, exert competitive pressure on Apple to discipline its pricing.”

Apple has also expanded the number of price points it supports in-store.

This may help some developers build more resilient businesses, but will also mean consumers must look twice at the prices before buying. There will be over 500 price points.

US developers will get $250-$30,000
Apple announced a $100 million fund to “assist qualifying US developers.” That means the smallest developers offering apps for sale or subscription will be able to claim $250, scaling up to $30,000 for those making more than $1 million each year.

The legal settlement reveals that 85% of Apple’s US developers make $5,000 or less per year via the store. It also reveals that the lawyers will be paid fees of up to $30 million from this fund.

Small business program
The settlement document confirms that Apple announced its small business program as a direct response to the class action. Under this scheme, businesses earning less than $1 million a year pay a 15% commission on sales, subsidized by larger developers who pay the 30% rate.

Apple says it will maintain this program for at least another three years. That’s alarming some developers, who also note that the scheme could still be improved and are concerned it may become finite.

Given that 85% of Apple’s US developers make less than $5,000/year, it is perhaps unsurprising that in its current incarnation Apple’s Small Business Program only dents App Store receipts to the tune of $59 million each year.

That means most of the billions the enterprise generates each year come from larger developers.

Follow the… search trail
Another interesting section in the deal sees Apple agree that search results will continue to be based on tangible data, such as star ratings or relevance for at least the next three years. That hints that Apple may extend its ad business more deeply into App Store search, which itself implies the company may have a wider plan around search. (Recent news that Google may pay as much as $15 billion to remain the default search engine on iOS means any such plan may impact Apple’s services income.)

(Some) more transparency
One final thing that may prove to be of interest in this affair is Apple’s commitment to publication of an annual transparency report in which it will provide the number of apps it has rejected, customer and developer accounts terminated for sketchy or fraudulent behavior, and information about search queries and results. It will also disclose the number of apps removed from the store each year.

We already have a rough idea how this report will work following the company’s publication of similar data in 2021.

Among other data points, that report claimed 95,000 apps were removed and 244 million customer accounts deactivated for fraud.

Critical voices remain strong
Announcing the news, Apple Fellow Phil Schiller said: “We would like to thank the developers who worked with us to reach these agreements in support of the goals of the App Store and to the benefit of all of our users.”

Epic’s Tim Sweeney seems unimpressed. Vowing to continue his company’s fight to force alternative payment methods into the App Store, he tweeted:

“Total coincidence that Apple abandoned its customer privacy commitments the same month they’re asking the US government to formally endorse and adopt Apple’s app store and payments monopoly in foreign trade negotiations?”

He was referring of course to Apple’s truly disturbing CSAM plans.

Analyst Benedict Evans notes that Apple’s App Store commission, combined with the estimated money it gets from Google for iOS searc,h adds up to more than the entire revenue of Netflix. It’s also more than that of Adobe – and McDonalds.

Evans seems to think it is inevitable regulators will eventually make decisions around all of this. I tend to agree.

Sen. Amy Klobuchar (D-Minn.), chair of the Senate Judiciary antitrust subcommittee, was supportive of the Apple move, but wants more: “This new action by Apple is a good first step towards addressing some of these competition concerns, but more must be done to ensure an open, competitive mobile app marketplace, including common sense legislation to set rules of the road for dominant app stores.”

It is important to note the settlement has not yet been approved by Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers, who is overseeing both this and Epic’s outstanding case. (You can read the legal briefing here.)

Regulators are currently investigating Apple’s App Store business model in multiple countries.

The reaction to Apple’s move tells me the company hasn’t yet gone far enough to silence critics. That’s why I believe the end result will see regulators set a series of limitations around this part of the company’s business — but doing so will take many years yet.

Please follow me on Twitter, or join me in the AppleHolic’s bar & grill and Apple Discussions groups on MeWe.

entry.title: Chromebook cheat sheet—— How to get started
entry.content:
Got a new Chromebook? This guide will help you navigate the ever-expanding world of Chromebook apps and figure out how to make the most of Chrome OS.

The beauty of Chrome OS today is its versatility: The operating system supports a huge range of applications in a variety of different formats — web apps, progressive web apps, native Chrome OS programs and Chrome browser extensions, Android apps, Linux apps, and sometimes even Windows apps (gracious!).

That’s enough to make anyone’s head spin. As a result of that platform-defying setup, though, Chromebooks can now handle all sorts of advanced productivity tasks and are viable far beyond their original web-centric focus, when the concept was quite literally just a “browser in a box” — a full-screen Chrome window with no desktop, nothing resembling a traditional app, and next to no options to consider.

But with power comes complexity, and — you guessed it — the weakness of Chrome OS today is that very same versatility. With so many types of apps and so many sources for software, it’s almost impossible to know where to begin and how to get started on your Chromebook adventure. And that’s to say nothing of figuring out the finer points of the operating system and how to optimize the environment for efficiency.

[ Related: Chrome OS: Tips, tools, and other Chromebook intelligence ]
The interface itself may still be relatively minimalist, compared to other operating systems — with its customizable dock (the “shelf”) for holding frequently-accessed programs, its scrolling app drawer (the “launcher”) for finding everything else installed on a system, and its Android-reminiscent settings and notification panel — but beyond that unassuming surface, there’s actually a fair amount going on.

For a platform once touted for its simplicity, things sure have gotten complicated. But they don’t have to be daunting. Follow this carefully crafted guide to getting started with Chrome OS — both finding the right apps from the right places and getting your system organized for optimal efficiency — and we’ll have you up and running with a custom-tuned setup in no time.

Step 1: Figure out what apps you need — and where to find them
The first step is simply to decide what software you need on your Chromebook — what apps will most effectively help you get your work (and non-work) accomplished. Make a quick list of your essentials: What app or service do you prefer to use for email? Do you need an app for chatting with colleagues? What about project management? Image editing? Note taking? Word processing and other office work?

Web apps
In general, with most Google apps and web-centric services, you’ll be fine sticking with the regular web versions — the same sites you always pull up in your browser. You can even create shortcuts to make them look and act more like apps and to keep them readily accessible: Just open the appropriate site in a normal browser tab, click the three-dot menu icon in Chrome’s upper-right corner, and then select “More tools” followed by “Create shortcut.” Give the shortcut whatever name you want — and if you’d like it to open in its own app-like window instead of a standard browser tab, select the “Open as window” option.

Progressive web apps
We’ve heard a lot of buzz lately about progressive web apps, or PWAs — apps that install directly from the browser and then look and act like regular desktop apps, with their own standalone windows and shortcuts, speedier start times, and built-in support for offline use.

PWAs can be a nice alternative to regular web apps, but the problem is that there just aren’t a ton of worthwhile options at this point — nor is there any spectacular storefront for browsing through available options.

Not to worry, though: I’ve got you covered. I maintain an evolving list of the best PWAs for productivity. You can reference that guide for a broader set of worthwhile recommendations, but here are a few quick highlights that are particularly relevant to the Chromebook realm:

The Todoist PWA looks, feels, and acts almost exactly like a regular local program, and it lets you work with your lists and notes even when you’re offline.
The Zoom PWA frees you from the scaled-back website version of the videoconferencing service and lets you make and place calls with a fuller set of features and an experience that’s optimized for the Chrome OS environment.
And Photopea can act as an admirable Photoshop-level graphics editing suite for your Chromebook, with or without an active internet connection.

For more exceptional PWAs worth exploring and a full explanation of the not-so-simple steps involved in installing them, make your way over to my complete guide.

Chrome OS programs and extensions
So you’ve got some regular web apps and maybe a progressive web app or two — excellent. Now think about if there might be some native Chrome OS programs or Chrome browser extensions that could flesh out your collection even further.

This area of the Chromebook experience can get a little confusing, and it’s mostly because of terminology. So brace yourself: “Chrome Apps” — as a proper noun — are no longer supported on the platform. Those were vaguely PWA-like packaged apps that had been present on Chrome OS early on but were phased out this summer.

You can, however, still find native Chrome OS programs, even if they aren’t technically “Chrome Apps.” First, the Chrome Web Store boasts a bunch of cross-platform Chrome browser extensions, which are program-like add-ons that bring a variety of useful functions into your regular Chrome windows.

For instance:

An extension called Text Blaze adds a powerful desktop-like text replacement system into the Chrome OS environment.
A clever Chrome collaboration tool called Bubbles gives you a super-simple way to create screencast videos and then share what you’re seeing with anyone — with or without your voice involved.
A Google-inspired screenshot markup system called Snippyly makes it simple as can be to capture and annotate screenshots and then send ‘em to anyone without having to resort to awkward attachments.

The Chrome Web Store also has an entire section of offline-capable extensions that are worth looking over.

Remember, too, that services such as Gmail, Google Docs, and Google Drive offer their own built-in offline options (though do be aware that you’ll need to enable the offline option in each of those services before it’ll work; you can find much more on that subject in my separate Chromebook offline guide). Chromebooks also come with a handful of preinstalled offline-capable apps, including a calculator, a plain text editor, an image editor, and a file manager. All of those should be in your device’s launcher and ready to roll right out of the gate.

Android apps
Another category of software that works offline and adds interesting possibilities into the Chrome OS environment is Google’s sprawling collection of Android apps — all the same stuff you’d install on your Android phone, from the very same Google Play Store storefront. Most current Chromebooks support the Play Store and offer it as an option within the Chrome OS launcher; if you don’t see it on your device, try opening up your Chromebook’s settings and searching for “Play Store” in the box at the top. If an option labeled “Google Play Store” comes up, click it and follow the steps to enable its presence. If no such option appears, your device is probably among the crop of older and lower-powered legacy Chromebooks that don’t support the feature.

The trick with Android apps on Chrome OS is to know which apps are worth getting — which, in other words, will actually enhance your Chromebook experience in some meaningful way. Especially since so many Android apps are also available in web-based forms, figuring that out isn’t always easy.

I maintain an evolving list of Android apps for Chromebooks that aims to identify the most worthwhile titles. Among the apps I’d recommend installing from the Play Store are either OneNote or Keep (depending on your note-taking preference), Duet Display (which lets you have your Chromebook double as a wireless second display for your Mac or PC, if you use multiple devices), and the Google Calendar Android app (which will let you access your calendar offline — something its web-based brother won’t do).

There are plenty more noteworthy options in the list, and it’s updated regularly with new recommendations.

Linux apps
The next type of app to consider one of the more recent additions to Chrome OS and one that certain older systems still can’t support: the geek-adored domain of Linux apps. Provided you have a reasonably recent Chromebook and don’t mind getting your hands a little dirty with technical trickery, it’s well worth your while to explore.

To start, click over to my Linux apps on Chrome OS guide to learn how to get Linux up and running on your system. Then, look through my evolving list of Linux app for Chromebook recommendations to see which titles might be right for you.

From a true native desktop Slack app to a fully featured local office suite and an Outlook-reminiscent email and calendar client, oodles of valuable options await.

Windows apps
Finally, if you work in a place that still relies on some traditional PC software, you might have the option to access a virtual Windows desktop and use apps from that environment right on your Chromebook (yes, really!).

Google started offering an option for companies to do that in 2020, and Microsoft is expected to follow suit with its own Windows 365 Cloud PC program in August.

This category of apps is relevant only if your employer has an enterprise-level license to use it, but if you are in that situation, it could be an important part of your Chromebook productivity picture. You can see more about how it works and what it’s like to use in my hands-on assessment.

Step 2: Organize your apps for easy access
With your apps all set, our next step is to get everything organized so you can access what you need with a minimal amount of ongoing effort. Chrome OS may not have a desktop in the traditional sense, but it does have two important areas for app storage, as we discussed at the start of this story: the launcher, or app drawer, and the shelf — the tray of docked icons at the bottom of the screen.

The launcher is where everything installed on your system appears. You can open it by either tapping your Chromebook’s Everything key (the one where Caps Lock usually goes, also sometimes known as the Search key or Launcher key) or by clicking the circle-shaped icon in the lower-left corner of the screen and then clicking the upward-facing arrow in the partial drawer that appears. If your device is a two-in-one that converts into a tablet — by swiveling the screen around past the 180-degree mark or by detaching the screen from the keyboard completely — the launcher will remain open on your desktop by default whenever it’s in a tablet state.

You can drag and drop icons throughout the launcher to change their order or drag icons atop other icons to form folders and organize things in any way you like. Truthfully, though, you probably won’t need to browse through that area too often; it’s far faster to simply tap the Everything key or click the circle-shaped icon in the lower-left corner of the screen and then start typing the name of the app you want. After one or maybe two letters, it should appear as the top option — and you can simply hit enter to open it.

For apps you open often, find them in the launcher, right-click (or two-finger tap) them, and then select “Pin to shelf.” Once the icon appears in your shelf, you can drag and drop it to change its position. Pay careful attention to that, as each position holds a hidden shortcut: From anywhere in the system, you can press Alt and the number key corresponding with an icon’s placement in your shelf to open the associated program (or shift your focus to it, if it’s already open).

Between the Alt-number key shortcut, the Alt-Tab app-switching command, and the Overview key (the key showing a box with two lines, directly to the left of the brightness controls on your keyboard), opening and moving among apps on Chrome OS can always be swift and snappy.

Step 3: Learn some advanced shortcuts and power-user tricks
Congratulations! Your Chromebook is officially stocked, organized, and ready to help you get stuff done. All that’s left to do now is think about learning some advanced tricks for getting around Chrome OS and taking advantage of everything it has to offer.

First of all, Chrome OS is filled with useful shortcuts beyond the few mentioned above. You can capture a screenshot by holding down Ctrl and then pressing the Overview key, for instance — or if you want to capture a specific area of the screen instead of the entire display, hit Ctrl, Shift, and the Overview key together and then use the on-screen guides to select any area you want.

Some other especially handy shortcuts worth remembering:

Action Key Combination
WINDOW MANAGEMENT
Dock window on the left Alt + [
Dock window on the right Alt + ]
Maximize window Alt + =
Minimize window Alt + -
Close current tab Ctrl + W
Close current window Ctrl + Shift + W
Move to a specific tab within a window Ctrl + 1 (or any number representing a tab’s position)
Open the Chrome browser menu Alt + E or Alt + F
WEB NAVIGATION
Open link in a new tab Ctrl + Shift + click the link
Open link in a new tab in the background Ctrl + click the link
Open link in a new window Shift + click the link
Go back to previous page in your history Alt + <
Go forward to next page in your history Alt + >
Go to the very top of a page Ctrl + Home or Ctrl + Alt + up arrow
Go to the very bottom of a page Ctrl + End or Ctrl + Alt + down arrow
Page down one screen Spacebar or Alt + down arrow
Page up one screen Shift + spacebar or Alt + up arrow
Start a new Google search from a tab Ctrl + K or Ctrl + E
Focus on the address bar Ctrl + L or Alt + D
SYSTEM TOOLS
Open the task manager Everything key + Esc
Make everything on screen larger Ctrl + Shift + =
Make everything on screen smaller Ctrl + Shift + -
Open the Files app Alt + Shift + M
Open the status bar/notification panel Alt + Shift + S or Alt + Shift + N
Turn Caps Lock on and off Alt + Everything key
Got all that? Good. Now, some Chromebook betterment projects worth pursuing — or hanging onto for a quiet day:

Creating your own custom Chrome address bar actions. With a few minutes of simple setup, you can give yourself super-fast shortcuts to practically anything imaginable — be it an element of your system, a specific website you frequent, or even a specific command within a website (like launching a new blank email draft).
Bringing widgets into Chrome OS. For all of its Android-inspired elements, one thing Chrome OS doesn’t support yet is the time-saving home screen widget. But there’s a workaround.
Cranking up your Chromebook’s cloud-connecting power. A few simple tweaks that’ll make your Chromebook an even more connected part of your cloud-centric setup.
Learning fast fixes for common Chrome OS problems. A list of common Chromebook problems you might encounter and the expert-approved solutions to solve ‘em.
Last but not least, if you want to get Google-centric tips and insight all throughout the year, take 20 seconds now to sign up for my Android Intelligence newsletter. It’ll bring all sorts of next-level knowledge to your inbox every Friday — just one email per week, from me to you.

This article was originally published in March 2019 and updated in August 2021.
